stories.original_headline: Single enzyme mutation reveals a hidden trigger in dementia
stories.original_summary: Researchers discovered that a tiny structural feature of the enzyme GPX4 helps keep neurons safe. A rare mutation removes this protection, allowing harmful molecules to damage cell membranes and trigger early dementia. Mouse and cell studies showed changes resembling Alzheimer’s. Early tests to slow
stories.fantasy_headline: Alchemists Uncover Secret of Mind-Fog Sickness
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Alchemists' Guild has unearthed a vital secret: a tiny imperfection in a magical protective charm can lead to the dreaded mind-fog sickness. This flaw allows dark wisps to cloud the spirit-cores, causing memories to fade. Wizards are now testing new potions to mend this charm and restore clear thought.

stories.original_headline: A cosmic collision reveals how black holes really behave
stories.original_summary: A remarkably clean gravitational-wave detection has confirmed long-standing predictions about black holes, including Hawking’s area theorem and Einstein’s ringdown behavior. The findings also provide the strongest support yet that real black holes follow the Kerr model.
stories.fantasy_headline: Cosmic Sages Confirm Ancient Lore of the Void-Maws
stories.fantasy_story: From a grand dance of celestial bodies, the Cosmic Sages have detected profound whispers from the void. These vibrations from the deep cosmos confirm ancient prophecies about the great void-maws, proving their mysterious ways align with long-held sagely wisdom. The findings bolster beliefs that these cosmic abysses follow the Kerr model.
